name: Google Calendar MCP Server (Convex Integration)
description: Google Calendar MCP Server with Convex-based authentication for multi-tenant deployment. Uses Node.js buildpack with Procfile for flexible deployment.

CONVEX_MODE.description: Enable Convex integration mode (set to 'true' for study-flow integration)

MCP_API_KEY.description: API key for authenticating token injection and management requests (generate a secure random string, min 32 characters)

GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID.description: Google OAuth 2.0 Client ID from Google Cloud Console

GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Google OAuth 2.0 Client Secret from Google Cloud Console

ALLOWED_ORIGINS.description: Comma-separated list of allowed CORS origins (e.g., https://your-study-flow-app.vercel.app)

TRANSPORT.description: Transport mode (http for Heroku deployment) - DEPRECATED: Use TRANSPORT_MODE instead

TRANSPORT_MODE.description: Dynamic transport selection: 'http' for web process (agent access), 'stdio' for mcp process (one-off dynos)

HOST.description: Host to bind to (0.0.0.0 for Heroku)

RATE_LIMIT_REQUESTS_PER_USER.description: Maximum calendar API requests per user per window (default: 100)

RATE_LIMIT_TOKEN_INJECTIONS_PER_IP.description: Maximum token injections per IP per window (default: 10)

RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MS.description: Rate limit time window in milliseconds (default: 15 minutes)

TOKEN_MIN_EXPIRY_BUFFER_MS.description: Minimum token expiry buffer in milliseconds (default: 5 minutes)

TOKEN_EXPIRY_WARNING_MS.description: Warn if token expires within this time in milliseconds (default: 10 minutes)

CLEANUP_INTERVAL_MS.description: Token cleanup interval in milliseconds (default: 30 minutes)

CLEANUP_STALE_THRESHOLD_MS.description: Remove tokens not accessed in this time in milliseconds (default: 24 hours)
